Class InventoryDAO

java.lang.Object
project2.InventoryDAO
public class InventoryDAO extends Object
Data-access object (DAO) for inventory-related queries and updates.

All methods open their own connection via DatabaseConnection.getConnection(), use try-with-resources for cleanup, and return simple DTOs or booleans.

Encapsulation note: This class exposes a lightweight InventoryDAO.InventoryItem DTO for read operations. It is intentionally simple and kept in the same file for convenience. Consider promoting it to its own top-level type with private fields and accessors if your project requires stronger encapsulation or future validation.

Thread-safety: The DAO has no shared mutable state; each call obtains a fresh DB connection, so the class is safe for concurrent use.

  • Method Details

    • getAllInventory

      public static List<InventoryDAO.InventoryItem> getAllInventory()
      Fetch all inventory rows ordered by ID.
      Returns:
      list of InventoryDAO.InventoryItem records; empty list on error
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - not thrown; SQL exceptions are caught and logged internally

    • getAllInventoryItems

      public static List<InventoryDAO.InventoryItem> getAllInventoryItems()
      Fetch all inventory rows ordered by ingredient name. Useful for populating selection widgets (combo boxes, lists) where alphabetical order is desired.
      Returns:
      list of InventoryDAO.InventoryItem records; empty list on error
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - not thrown; SQL exceptions are caught and logged internally

    • getLowStockItems

      public static List<InventoryDAO.InventoryItem> getLowStockItems()
      Fetch items with quantity below a fixed low-stock threshold (currently 10).
      Returns:
      list of low-stock InventoryDAO.InventoryItem records; empty list on error
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - not thrown; SQL exceptions are caught and logged internally

    • deductIngredientsForOrder

      public static boolean deductIngredientsForOrder(int menuItemId)
      Deduct one unit from the quantity of each ingredient required by a given menu item (according to the menu_recipe mapping).

      Transactional note: This method performs a single UPDATE that affects all related ingredients. For multi-step ordering flows where consistency across several tables matters, consider managing an explicit transaction in a higher layer.

      Parameters:
      menuItemId - the menu item ID whose recipe ingredients should be decremented
      Returns:
      true if the update statement executed (rows updated may be 0 if recipe is empty); false if a database error occurred
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - not thrown; SQL exceptions are caught and logged internally

    • checkIngredientsInStock

      public static boolean checkIngredientsInStock(int menuItemId)
      Check whether all ingredients required by a menu item are in stock. An ingredient is considered out of stock when its quantity is <= 0.
      Parameters:
      menuItemId - the menu item ID to check
      Returns:
      true if no required ingredients are out of stock; otherwise false
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - not thrown; SQL exceptions are caught and logged internally
